intro: Ctenitis desvauxii, commonly known as the Desvaux's tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its fronds are typically a deep green and have a distinctive, feathery appearance. Ctenitis desvauxii is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
